faqSection.title: Frequently asked questions
faqSection.subtitle: You've got questions. We've got honest answers.

q1.question: What is SABSUS and what does it include?
q1.answer:
SABSUS is an all-in-one ecosystem for restaurants, cafés, bakeries, dark kitchens, and retail.

Included in every plan:

• POS system
• CRM & loyalty
• Warehouse & ingredients management
• Delivery with zone pricing
• Finances, tips, salaries
• Real-time analytics & reports
• Order tracking & table layout
• Cloud infrastructure + multilingual support
• Web and mobile apps

q2.question: Do I need to install any hardware?
q2.answer:
No. SABSUS runs in any browser and on any device:

• Tablets (Android/iOS)
• Desktops, POS terminals
• Smartphones

All interfaces are responsive and touch-optimized.

q3.question: How is SABSUS different from other POS/CRM solutions?
q3.answer:
Most systems give you 1–2 modules. We give you everything:

• Full cycle from order to delivery
• Loyalty, feedback, barcode scanner
• Promotions, staff salaries, table maps
• Multi-language interfaces + AI-translations
• App + website under your brand (white-label option)
• No hidden fees, no commissions (unless you choose them).

q4.question: What's the difference between SaaS and White-label plans?
q4.answer:
SaaS Subscription vs White-label Subscription:

• Works under SABSUS brand vs Branded app & website
• $89–289/mo vs $249–899/mo
• No app store presence vs Published on App Store & Google Play
• Common server vs Separate server & database

q5.question: Can I buy the app instead of subscribing?
q5.answer:
Yes. You can fully buy out the white-label app without any subscription.

What you get:

• Lifetime license
• 1 year of updates and support
• Full control of your database & integrations
• $50/month optional maintenance after 1 year

Prices start from:

• $14,000 (1 venue, 1 language)
• $25,000 (up to 3 venues, 2 languages)
• $35,000 (up to 10 venues, all languages)

q6.question: Are future updates included in the lifetime model?
q6.answer:
Yes — the first year is included.

After that, updates and support are available at a fixed price of $50/month.

You are not forced to update if you don't want to.

q7.question: Can I migrate my existing data from other POS/CRM systems?
q7.answer: Yes. We provide data import tools or help you migrate from systems like Square, Toast, Loyverse, Poster, iiko, and others.

q8.question: What languages are supported?
q8.answer:
Currently:

• English
• Spanish
• Russian
• Ukrainian

The system auto-switches based on user preference. White-label apps can be locked to 1–4 languages depending on plan.

q9.question: How do I manage multiple locations or brands?
q9.answer:
SABSUS is built for this:

• Centralized dashboards
• Custom tax & menu per location
• Analytics and staff per venue
• Inventory sync with separate warehouse settings

You can manage 1 to 100+ venues easily.

q10.question: What is the refund policy?
q10.answer:
Monthly subscriptions can be canceled anytime.

App buyout and branding fees are non-refundable (as they include custom development, publication, and assets).

We recommend starting with a demo or 1-month subscription first.

q11.question: How secure is my data?
q11.answer:
• Hosted on Google Cloud / Supabase
• Encrypted backups
• Staff logs & permission controls
• GDPR/SOC2-ready infrastructure

You control your database (in white-label or buyout mode)

q12.question: What if my internet goes down?
q12.answer:
SABSUS supports offline mode for POS operations.

Orders and receipts sync automatically when the network is restored.

q13.question: Do you offer custom development or API access?
q13.answer:
Yes:

• API available in white-label & buyout plans
• Integration with Stripe, Telegram, Uber Eats, Google Maps, etc.

You can request features or pay for custom modules

q14.question: Can I connect external printers, card readers, or delivery aggregators?

Yes.

Supported:

• Uber Eats (ready), Doordash (coming)
• SMS, email, and push integrations built-in

instantOrderProcessing.desc: Take orders in seconds with smart presets, modifiers, and intuitive navigation. Works equally fast on tablets, terminals, or smartphones.

multiModeOrderTypes.title: Multi-mode order types
multiModeOrderTypes.desc: Handle dine-in, delivery, and pickup in one flow. Assign tables, print kitchen tickets, or send to the app with a tap.

dynamicTableManagement.title: Dynamic table management
dynamicTableManagement.desc: Visual map of your venue with live updates. Move, merge, split checks — all in real time.

shiftStaffTracking.title: Shift & staff tracking
shiftStaffTracking.desc: Logins with PINs, auto time tracking, and per-role permissions. Built-in attendance, tips, and performance overview.

qrPaymentsDeposits.title: QR payments & deposits
qrPaymentsDeposits.desc: Print QR codes for instant checkout or deposits. Customers scan, pay, and go — no hardware required.

kitchenPrinterRouting.title: Kitchen & printer routing
kitchenPrinterRouting.desc: Orders are automatically sent to the right station — drinks to bar, mains to kitchen. Supports multilingual receipts and multiple printers.

onTheFlyMenuUpdates.title: On-the-fly menu updates
onTheFlyMenuUpdates.desc: Add, disable, or edit products in seconds. Changes sync instantly across POS, kitchen, and app.

endOfShiftReports.title: End-of-shift reports
endOfShiftReports.desc: Close shifts with full financial breakdowns. Track card, cash, and delivery payments, plus tips and staff bonuses.

keyCapabilitiesSection3.title: Key Capabilities

keyCapabilitiesSection3.description: Live order statuses, recipe breakdowns, timers and pickup coordination built for your kitchen crew.

brandedMobileApp.title: Branded Mobile App
brandedMobileApp.desc: Get a custom app with your brand's logo and colors. Great for user engagement and repeat orders.

loyaltyPrograms.title: Loyalty Programs
loyaltyPrograms.desc: Set up bonuses, cashback or discounts based on user activity. Build habits and retain your best.

smartDeliveryOptions.title: Smart Delivery Options
smartDeliveryOptions.desc: Choose from delivery, pickup, or dine-in. Auto-location and saved addresses included.

pushNotifications.title: Push Notifications
pushNotifications.desc: Send timely updates about orders, promos or new arrivals. Drive engagement and reduce no-shows.

orderHistoryRepeats.title: Order History & Repeats
orderHistoryRepeats.desc: Let users reorder in seconds from their past purchases. Track preferences for experience.

tableReservations.title: Table Reservations
tableReservations.desc: Book tables in advance with time slots and guest count. Reduce queues and optimize floor space.

customerFeedback.title: Customer Feedback
customerFeedback.desc: Collect reviews and ratings per order. Show you listen, and build trust.

personalAccountArea.title: Personal Account Area
personalAccountArea.desc: Manage orders, loyalty status, saved data, and preferences. A seamless all-in-one experience for users.

kitchenPrepInsights2.title: Live Prep Insights
kitchenPrepInsights2.heading: Precision and speed from prep to plate
kitchenPrepInsights2.description: Track real-time cooking progress across all stations with synced kitchen displays. Each order flows through clear stages — prep, cook, serve — with glowing indicators.
kitchenPrepInsights2.footerText: Timers, alerts, and zone assignments make sure every dish is ready exactly when it should be. Designed to reduce chaos and maximize performance.

discovery.title: Business Analysis First
discovery.desc: We dive into how your business operates: workflows, audience, and pain points. We examine how orders are taken, inventory is tracked, and deliveries are managed. Then we form growth hypotheses: what modules to connect, where you're losing money, how to win back customers. We only launch what brings real value.

scope.title: Clear Scope and Plan
scope.desc: We don't sell 'the box.' Instead, we discuss the exact modules you need: POS, CRM, terminals, online orders, delivery. You know in advance what will be connected, how the interface will look, and what results to expect. We simplify decision-making and remove the fog around 'what will come out of this.'

prototyping.desc: You're never left with just instructions. Our team helps upload your menu, design your system, set up payments, couriers, inventory, and analytics. We test every step live — during setup. Your team is fully involved, as if it were their own product.

syncs.title: Constant Feedback Loop
syncs.desc: We conduct regular check-ins: what works, what can be improved. We stay in touch via WhatsApp/Telegram, Zoom, and in-app support. You're part of the process — not stuck waiting. We keep tasks visible, share demo reports, and develop new ideas together.

design.title: Branded Design and Real Results
design.desc: All interfaces — from mobile apps to terminals — are tailored to your brand. Ease of use never compromises efficiency. Every decision is tested on real orders and customers. The focus is not just on looks, but on boosting your average check and speeding up service.

flexibility.title: Flexibility Without Chaos
flexibility.desc: Switched to a new format? Added deliveries or dine-in? Changed staff? Sabsus adapts seamlessly to your evolving needs — no technical headaches. We preserve your structure and progress, even if you switch from a competitor or scale up rapidly.

quality.title: Quality in Every Detail
quality.desc: Every receipt, order, translation, and QR code is checked. Interfaces are built not 'as they turn out,' but for real-world use — by cashiers, waiters, chefs, and clients. Fonts, loading speed, autocomplete, multilingual support — every detail matters.

support.title: Long-Term Partnership
support.desc: Our goal isn't just to launch your POS — but to grow with you. You get updates, new modules, analytics, marketing tools, and team training. We don't just hand over a system. We walk with you toward profit and scale.

4.1.title: 4.1 Role of Sabsus and the Restaurant.
4.1.text: Sabsus is a technology platform connecting Users with Restaurants. When you place an order (e.g., food delivery, pickup, table booking, gift certificate purchase), you enter into a transaction directly with the relevant Restaurant. Sabsus is not the seller or provider of the goods/services ordered; it merely facilitates the transaction and interaction. We are not responsible for quality, safety, description accuracy or availability of Restaurant goods/services, but we make reasonable efforts to collaborate only with reliable partners.

4.2.title: 4.2 Order Process.
4.2.text: Select items from a Restaurant menu or catalogue, specify quantity and options, add to cart and proceed to checkout. Before confirming, you will see a summary: items, price, taxes, delivery fee (if applicable) and total payable, plus estimated fulfilment time. Check the information carefully before confirming. Once confirmed, the order is sent to the Restaurant. Ability to cancel or change an order after confirmation may be limited (see 4.6).

4.3.title: 4.3 Price and Payment.
4.3.text: Prices are set by Restaurants and shown in the User's local currency unless stated otherwise. We strive to keep prices current, but rare delays in updates may occur; the final price is confirmed at checkout. Payment is usually online through our Platform using integrated payment systems. Sabsus receives payments on behalf of the Restaurant as its payment agent; your obligation to pay is fulfilled when funds are successfully charged via the Service.

4.4.title: 4.4 Payment Methods.
4.4.text: Currently, Sabsus supports card and e-wallet payments processed by Stripe and PayPal. You may be redirected to a secure page of the provider or an embedded interface. Card details are transmitted directly to the provider and are not stored on our servers, except for a token allowing transaction confirmation. By completing payment you agree to the provider's terms (including any fees, refund rules and security policies set by Stripe or PayPal) paypal.com. A payment may be declined by your card-issuing bank for various reasons; in that case the order is not considered paid, and you must choose another method or contact the bank.

4.5.title: 4.5 Taxes and Tips.
4.5.text: Depending on the Restaurant's and User's jurisdictions, applicable taxes (e.g., VAT, sales tax) may be added and shown separately at checkout. If the Platform allows tipping, you can specify a tip amount before payment. The final amount, including taxes and tips, is displayed before charging. Tips are optional and may be changed by you until payment confirmation.

4.6.title: 4.6 Cancellation and Refunds.
4.6.text:
Food/drink orders: Once a Restaurant has accepted an order, cancellation without charge is usually impossible. If you request cancellation immediately after ordering, contact Sabsus support—we will try to help but cannot guarantee cancellation if the Restaurant has confirmed it.

Table bookings: If a deposit is taken, refund rules depend on the Restaurant's policy (e.g., free cancellation 24 hours in advance). 

Gift cards/coupons: Purchased gift certificates are non-refundable except as required by law. 

Other services: Terms are agreed individually. If service quality is unsatisfactory or an order is not fulfilled, contact Sabsus support with a claim. If confirmed, we will process a refund or other compensation. Refunds, if approved, are made via the original payment method. Posting times depend on bank/payment-system procedures (usually 5–10 business days).

4.7.title: 4.7 Electronic Receipts
4.7.text: After successful payment you receive an electronic receipt at your account email or within the app. Keep these receipts for warranty service, refunds or accounting.

4.8.text: Report double charges, incorrect amounts or other payment issues to Sabsus as soon as possible. We will investigate with the provider and, if an error is confirmed, correct it. 5.1.text: Sabsus may operate a loyalty programme (e.g., earning points per purchase). Participation is voluntary and automatic for registered Users: qualifying actions credit points to your loyalty account (e.g., 1 point per 10 currency units spent). Current accrual structure and redemption rules are available in the "Bonus Programme" section of the Platform or our website.

5.2.title: 5.2 Earning and Using Points
5.2.text: Points are not electronic money; they have no cash value. They cannot be cashed out or transferred (unless the programme explicitly allows, e.g., a family account). You may redeem points for rewards according to the reward catalogue (e.g., order discount, free item). When applying points, the corresponding amount is deducted and the order total reduced.

5.3.text: Each promotion may impose point expiry (e.g., valid for one year), maximum account balance, monthly redemption limits, etc. Sabsus may change the programme terms, notifying Users (e.g., via site update or email). 5.4.title: 5.4 Programme Termination or Suspension.
5.4.text: Sabsus may end or replace the loyalty programme at any time. Users will have a reasonable period (e.g., 30 days) to use remaining points. After that, unused points are cancelled without compensation. We will notify Users in advance through electronic channels.

5.5.text: The Platform supports issuance and use of electronic Restaurant gift cards. Purchase: Users can buy cards of specified denominations (e.g., 1 000 RUB, 5 000 RUB) for themselves or as gifts. Payment is processed via the Service. After payment, a unique gift-card code is generated and sent to your email or printable. Use: The holder enters the code in the "Gift card / promo code" field at checkout. If the order exceeds the card value, the balance is paid by another method; if lower, unused balance remains on the card.

5.6.title: 5.6 Gift-Card Terms.
5.6.text: The card is not personalised and can be used by anyone who knows the code—treat it like cash. Protect the code; we are not liable for unauthorised use of lost/stolen codes. Non-refundability: purchase is final unless required by law. Validity: unless stated otherwise, cards are valid indefinitely (or the maximum term allowed by local law). Some regions require expiry or dormancy fees—if so, we will disclose this at purchase. No cash exchange: cards cannot be redeemed for cash except where mandated (certain US states allow cash-out of small remaining balances). Use restriction: a card pays only for goods/services of the specified Restaurant (or group). It cannot buy another gift card. Fraud suspicion: Sabsus may suspend a card and request additional information if fraud is suspected.
